articles.title: Lyrid meteor shower set to dazzle stargazers on Saturday with up to 18 meteors an hour - Daily Mail
articles.description: The Lyrid shower takes its name from the constellation of Lyra, where the shooting stars appear to originate from. It will peak at 2:06 BST on Sunday April 23.
articles.content:
Stargazers are in for a treat this weekend, as the Lyrid meteor shower is returning for its annual dance across the night skies.
